text: Caput is an extinct town in Barton County, in the U.S. state of Missouri. The town site is approximately five miles northwest of Lamar. A post office called Caput was established in 1871, and remained in operation until 1895. Besides the post office, the community had a schoolhouse. The name Caput most likely is derived from Latin. ==References== Category:Ghost towns in Missouri Category:Former populated places in Barton County, Missouri
title: Caput, Missouri
